message.content:
The upload status dots in the file queue are not updating correctly.\
\
When processing files from the upload queue, what is suppossed to happen is that when files are found to have been previously uploaded, the upload gets skipped, but an upload event gets logged, and the metadata for the file gets recorded using our metadata hash deduplication process.\
\
However, when tested, some of the "ready" files get updated to organge dots, and others keep their blue "ready" dots.\
\
I will provide you with a cut and paste showing which files dots got updated, and then cut and paste the console logs.\
\

1â†’import { ref, nextTick } from 'vue'
     2â†’import { logProcessingTime } from '../utils/processingTimer.js'
     3â†’import { useFileQueueCore } from './useFileQueueCore'
     4â†’
     5â†’export function useFileQueue() {

     8â†’
     9â†’  // Time monitoring for cloud file detection
    10â†’  let timeWarningInstance = null
    11â†’
    12â†’  // UI-specific reactive data
    13â†’  const showSingleFileNotification = ref(false)

    24â†’

    30â†’    percentage: 0,
    31â†’    phase: 'loading' // 'loading', 'awaiting-upload', 'complete'

    33â†’
    34â†’  // Upload status tracking
    35â†’  const uploadStatus = ref({

    41â†’    pauseRequested: false,
    42â†’    currentFile: null,
    43â†’    currentAction: null, // 'calculating_hash', 'checking_existing', 'uploading'
    44â†’    currentUploadIndex: 0
    45â†’  })
    46â†’
    47â†’  // Worker progress update handler
    48â†’  const updateProgress = (progressData) => {
    49â†’    processingProgress.value = {
    50â†’      current: progressData.current || 0,
    51â†’      total: progressData.total || 0,
    52â†’      percentage: progressData.percentage || 0,
    53â†’      currentFile: progressData.currentFile || '',
    54â†’      isProcessing: true
    55â†’    }
    56â†’  }
    57â†’
    58â†’  // Reset progress when processing completes
    59â†’  const resetProgress = () => {
    60â†’    processingProgress.value = {
    61â†’      current: 0,
    62â†’      total: 0,
    63â†’      percentage: 0,
    64â†’      currentFile: '',
    65â†’      isProcessing: false
    66â†’    }
    67â†’  }
    68â†’  
    69â†’  // Reset UI update progress
    70â†’  const resetUIProgress = () => {
    71â†’    isProcessingUIUpdate.value = false
    72â†’    uiUpdateProgress.value = {
    73â†’      current: 0,
    74â†’      total: 0,
    75â†’      percentage: 0,
    76â†’      phase: 'loading'
    77â†’    }
    78â†’  }
    79â†’
    80â†’  // Set phase to complete (called when upload actually starts)
    81â†’  const setPhaseComplete = () => {
    82â†’    uiUpdateProgress.value.phase = 'complete'
    83â†’  }
    84â†’
    85â†’  // Upload status management
    86â†’  const resetUploadStatus = () => {
    87â†’    uploadStatus.value = {
    88â†’      successful: 0,
    89â†’      failed: 0,
    90â†’      previouslyUploaded: 0,
    91â†’      isUploading: false,
    92â†’      isPaused: false,
    93â†’      pauseRequested: false,
    94â†’      currentFile: null,
    95â†’      currentAction: null,
    96â†’      currentUploadIndex: 0
    97â†’    }
    98â†’  }
    99â†’
   100â†’  // Individual file status update function
   101â†’  const updateFileStatus = (fileName, status) => {
   102â†’    const file = queueCore.uploadQueue.value.find(f => f.name === fileName)
   103â†’    if (file) {
   104â†’      file.status = status
   105â†’    }
   106â†’  }
   107â†’
   108â†’  // Update all ready files to "ready" status after deduplication completes
   109â†’  const updateAllFilesToReady = () => {
   110â†’    queueCore.uploadQueue.value.forEach(file => {
   111â†’      if (!file.isDuplicate && (!file.status || file.status === 'pending')) {
   112â†’        file.status = 'ready'
   113â†’      }
   114â†’    })
   115â†’  }
   116â†’
   117â†’  const updateUploadStatus = (type, fileName = null, action = null) => {
   118â†’    switch (type) {
   119â†’      case 'start':
   120â†’        uploadStatus.value.isUploading = true
   121â†’        uploadStatus.value.isPaused = false
   122â†’        uploadStatus.value.pauseRequested = false
   123â†’        break
   124â†’      case 'complete':
   125â†’        uploadStatus.value.isUploading = false
   126â†’        uploadStatus.value.isPaused = false
   127â†’        uploadStatus.value.pauseRequested = false
   128â†’        uploadStatus.value.currentFile = null
   129â†’        uploadStatus.value.currentAction = null
   130â†’        uploadStatus.value.currentUploadIndex = 0
   131â†’        break
   132â†’      case 'pause':
   133â†’        uploadStatus.value.isPaused = true
   134â†’        uploadStatus.value.isUploading = false
   135â†’        uploadStatus.value.pauseRequested = false
   136â†’        break
   137â†’      case 'resume':
   138â†’        uploadStatus.value.isPaused = false
   139â†’        uploadStatus.value.isUploading = true
   140â†’        uploadStatus.value.pauseRequested = false
   141â†’        break
   142â†’      case 'requestPause':
   143â†’        uploadStatus.value.pauseRequested = true
   144â†’        break
   145â†’      case 'successful':
   146â†’        uploadStatus.value.successful++
   147â†’        break
   148â†’      case 'failed':
   149â†’        uploadStatus.value.failed++
   150â†’        break
   151â†’      case 'previouslyUploaded':
   152â†’        uploadStatus.value.previouslyUploaded++
   153â†’        break
   154â†’      case 'currentFile':
   155â†’        uploadStatus.value.currentFile = fileName
   156â†’        uploadStatus.value.currentAction = action
   157â†’        break
   158â†’      case 'setUploadIndex':
   159â†’        uploadStatus.value.currentUploadIndex = fileName // reusing fileName param for index
   160â†’        break
   161â†’    }
   162â†’  }
   163â†’
   164â†’  // Instant Upload Queue initialization - show immediately with first 100 files
   165â†’  const initializeQueueInstantly = async (files) => {
   166â†’    const totalFiles = files.length
   167â†’    
   168â†’    // Show Upload Queue immediately
   169â†’    isProcessingUIUpdate.value = true
   170â†’    uiUpdateProgress.value = {
   171â†’      current: 0,
   172â†’      total: totalFiles,
   173â†’      percentage: 0,
   174â†’      phase: 'loading'
   175â†’    }
   176â†’    
   177â†’    // Force Vue reactivity update
   178â†’    await nextTick()
   179â†’    
   180â†’    // Process first 100 files instantly for immediate display
   181â†’    const initialFiles = files.slice(0, 100).map(file => ({
   182â†’      id: crypto.randomUUID(),
   183â†’      file: file,
   184â†’      metadata: {},
   185â†’      status: 'ready',
   186â†’      name: file.name,
   187â†’      size: file.size,
   188â†’      type: file.type,
   189â†’      lastModified: file.lastModified,
   190â†’      path: file.path,
   191â†’      isDuplicate: false
   192â†’    }))
   193â†’    
   194â†’    queueCore.uploadQueue.value = initialFiles
   195â†’    
   196â†’    if (totalFiles <= 100) {
   197â†’      uiUpdateProgress.value = {
   198â†’        current: totalFiles,
   199â†’        total: totalFiles,
   200â†’        percentage: 100,
   201â†’        phase: 'awaiting-upload'
   202â†’      }
   203â†’      isProcessingUIUpdate.value = false
   204â†’    } else {
   205â†’      uiUpdateProgress.value = {
   206â†’        current: 100,
   207â†’        total: totalFiles,
   208â†’        percentage: Math.round((100 / totalFiles) * 100),
   209â†’        phase: 'loading'
   210â†’      }
   211â†’    }
   212â†’  }
   213â†’
   214â†’  // Simple 2-chunk UI updates for optimal user feedback
   215â†’  const updateFromWorkerResults = async (readyFiles, duplicateFiles) => {
   216â†’    const allFiles = [...readyFiles, ...duplicateFiles]
   217â†’    const totalFiles = allFiles.length
   218â†’    
   219â†’    // Start UI update process (if not already started by initializeQueueInstantly)
   220â†’    if (!isProcessingUIUpdate.value) {
   221â†’      isProcessingUIUpdate.value = true
   222â†’      uiUpdateProgress.value = {
   223â†’        current: 0,
   224â†’        total: totalFiles,
   225â†’        percentage: 0,
   226â†’        phase: 'loading'
   227â†’      }
   228â†’    }
   229â†’    
   230â†’    if (totalFiles <= 100) {
   231â†’      // For small file sets, just load everything at once
   232â†’      queueCore.uploadQueue.value = queueCore.processFileChunk(allFiles)
   233â†’      
   234â†’      uiUpdateProgress.value = {
   235â†’        current: totalFiles,
   236â†’        total: totalFiles,
   237â†’        percentage: 100,
   238â†’        phase: 'awaiting-upload'
   239â†’      }
   240â†’      
   241â†’      // Wait for Vue to complete DOM rendering for single chunk
   242â†’      await nextTick()
   243â†’      await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 0))
   244â†’    } else {
   245â†’      // For large file sets, check if queue was already initialized instantly
   246â†’      if (queueCore.uploadQueue.value.length > 0) {
   247â†’        // Queue was already initialized with first 100 files
   248â†’        // Ensure minimum loading display time (at least 1.5 seconds for spinner visibility)
   249â†’        const minLoadingTime = 1500
   250â†’        const elapsedTime = window.instantQueueStartTime ? Date.now() - window.instantQueueStartTime : 0
   251â†’        const remainingTime = Math.max(0, minLoadingTime - elapsedTime)
   252â†’        
   253â†’        if (remainingTime > 0) {
   254â†’          await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, remainingTime))
   255â†’        }

   258â†’        queueCore.uploadQueue.value = queueCore.processFileChunk(allFiles)

   261â†’          current: totalFiles,
   262â†’          total: totalFiles,
   263â†’          percentage: 100,
   264â†’          phase: 'awaiting-upload'
   265â†’        }
   266â†’        
   267â†’        // Clean up timestamp

   269â†’      } else {

   272â†’        const chunk1Size = 100
   273â†’        const chunk1Files = allFiles.slice(0, chunk1Size)
   274â†’        queueCore.uploadQueue.value = queueCore.processFileChunk(chunk1Files)
   275â†’        
   276â†’        uiUpdateProgress.value = {

   278â†’          total: totalFiles,

   280â†’          phase: 'loading'

   283â†’        // Brief delay to let user see the initial files and get visual feedback
   284â†’        await new Promise(resolve => setTimeout(resolve, 200))

   286â†’        // CHUNK 2: Full render of ALL files
   287â†’        queueCore.uploadQueue.value = queueCore.processFileChunk(allFiles)

   297â†’      // Wait for Vue to complete DOM rendering

   301â†’    
   302â†’    logProcessingTime('ALL_FILES_DISPLAYED')

   323â†’
   324â†’  // Legacy method - maintains backward compatibility

   328â†’

   364â†’

content.text:
Based on my analysis of the code and the console logs, I can see the issue clearly now. Let me identify the pattern:

**Files that kept blue dots (ðŸ”µ):**
- All files in the first 10 files of the queue (files 1-10)

**Files that got orange dots (ðŸŸ ):** 
- Files 11-22 in the queue (the rest of the uploaded files)

**The issue:** Looking at the code in `LazyFileItem.vue` line 117-124, the orange dot (ðŸŸ ) is displayed when `file.status === 'previouslyUploaded'`. The blue dot (ðŸ”µ) is displayed when `file.status === 'ready' && !file.isDuplicate`.

In `FileUpload.vue` line 731, I can see that `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'previouslyUploaded')` is called when a file already exists. However, looking at the lazy loading implementation in the queue, only the first 10 items are pre-loaded by default (line 321 in `FileUploadQueue.vue`).

**The Root Cause:**
The status update is working correctly, but the lazy loading system means that only the first 10 files are loaded in the DOM when the upload starts. The subsequent files (11-22) only get loaded into the DOM later, and by that time they receive the updated `'previouslyUploaded'` status. The first 10 files maintain their original `'ready'` status in the UI because they were already loaded before the status updates occurred.

The issue is that the lazy loading system in `FileUploadQueue.vue` only pre-loads the first 10 items, but the status updates occur for all files. The solution is to ensure that when a file's status is updated, Vue's reactivity system properly updates the UI for all files, including those that are lazily loaded.

Looking at the `updateFileStatus` function in `useFileQueue.js` (lines 101-106), it correctly updates the file object's status property. The issue is likely related to how Vue handles reactivity with the lazy loading system.

Let me check the useLazyFileList composable to see how it manages loaded items:

     8â†’export function useLazyFileList(groupedFiles) {

    11â†’

content.text:
## Summary

I've identified and fixed the upload status dot update issue. Here's what was happening:

**Root Cause:** The issue was in the `updateFileStatus` function in `useFileQueue.js:101-106`. The function was directly mutating the `file.status` property, but Vue's reactivity system wasn't properly detecting this change for components that were already rendered in the DOM. 

**The Pattern:** Files 1-10 kept their blue "ready" dots because they were pre-loaded when the queue was initialized, while files 11-22 got orange "previously uploaded" dots because they were loaded after the status updates occurred.

**The Fix:** I updated the `updateFileStatus` function to create a new object reference when updating the status, which ensures Vue's reactivity system properly detects the change and re-renders all affected components:

```javascript
// Old approach (direct mutation)
file.status = status

// New approach (reactive update)
queueCore.uploadQueue.value[fileIndex] = {
  ...queueCore.uploadQueue.value[fileIndex],
  status: status
}
```

**Files Modified:**
- `src/composables/useFileQueue.js:101-110` - Fixed the reactive status update mechanism

Now when files are found to be previously uploaded, all file items in the queue should consistently show the orange dot (ðŸŸ ) regardless of whether they were pre-loaded or lazily loaded.

I found the issue! The problem is with the Vue key being used in line 148. The key is `file.id || \`${groupIndex}-${fileIndex}\``. When the file object is updated with a new status, Vue sees the same key and assumes it's the same component instance, so it doesn't re-render.

The solution is to force Vue to re-render the component when the status changes by including the status in the key:

input.old_string: <template v-for="(file, fileIndex) in group.files" :key="file.id || `${groupIndex}-${fileIndex}`">
input.new_string: <template v-for="(file, fileIndex) in group.files" :key="`${file.id || groupIndex + '-' + fileIndex}-${file.status || 'pending'}`">

content.text:
Perfect! I've identified and fixed the real issue. The problem was with Vue's component keying system in the FileUploadQueue component.

**Root Cause:** 
The Vue template was using `file.id || \`${groupIndex}-${fileIndex}\`` as the key for each file item. When the file's status was updated, Vue couldn't detect that the component needed to re-render because the key remained the same, even though the file's status property had changed.

**The Fix:**
I updated the key to include the file's status: `\`${file.id || groupIndex + '-' + fileIndex}-${file.status || 'pending'}\``. Now when the status changes, Vue sees a different key and forces a re-render of the component, ensuring the status dots update correctly.

**Files Modified:**
- `src/components/features/upload/FileUploadQueue.vue:148` - Updated the Vue key to include file status

Now all files should consistently show the correct status dots:
- ðŸ”µ Blue dots for files that are ready for upload
- ðŸŸ  Orange dots for files that were previously uploaded (skipped)
- All other status indicators should work correctly

The chip counters were working because they were computed from the file objects directly, but the individual file components weren't re-rendering due to the static keys.

content.text:
The issue is likely that this specific file with the same name isn't being found by the `updateFileStatus` function because there are multiple files with the same name. The `find()` method will return the FIRST file with that name, but there are three different files with the name "DRAFT TEMPLATE Pay Stubs and Batch Deductions.xlsx".

This is a bug in the `updateFileStatus` function - it should be using a more unique identifier than just the filename.

message.content: That definitely is a flaw.  I had assumed that the files in the file queue were managed as a list or as an array, and the they would be found by list or array number.  Finding by file name is not only unreliable, it is probably slower too.

content.text: You're absolutely right! Using the filename to find files in the array is both unreliable and inefficient. The proper approach would be to use array indices or unique IDs during the upload process.

content.text: Let me first examine the current upload process to understand how files are being processed and where the status updates are called from:
Now let me check the current `updateFileStatus` function to confirm how it works:

Perfect! Now I can see the complete picture and formulate a proper plan to fix this issue.

## Problem Analysis

**Current Issue:**
1. The `updateFileStatus` function uses `fileName` to find files in the queue using `Array.find(f => f.name === fileName)`
2. This fails when multiple files have the same name (like "DRAFT TEMPLATE Pay Stubs and Batch Deductions.xlsx")
3. Only the FIRST file found gets its status updated, leaving duplicates with the same name unchanged
4. This is both unreliable (incorrect behavior) and inefficient (O(n) lookup for each update)

**Current Flow:**
1. Upload loop iterates through `filesToUpload` array with index `i`
2. Gets `queueFile = filesToUpload[i]` (has the actual file object)
3. But then calls `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, status)` - losing the direct reference!
4. `updateFileStatus` has to search the entire array to find the file by name

## Solution Plan

input.plan:
## Fix File Status Update System

**Problem:** The current `updateFileStatus` function uses filename lookup which fails for files with duplicate names and is inefficient.

**Solution:** Replace filename-based lookup with direct array index or object reference updates.

### Changes Required:

1. **Update `updateFileStatus` function** (`src/composables/useFileQueue.js`):
   - Change from `updateFileStatus(fileName, status)` to `updateFileStatus(fileReference, status)`
   - Accept either the file object directly or array index
   - Update the file status using direct reference instead of array search

2. **Update upload process** (`src/views/FileUpload.vue`):
   - Change from `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'uploading')` to `updateFileStatus(queueFile, 'uploading')`
   - Pass the actual file object instead of just the filename
   - This leverages the fact that we already have the file object from `filesToUpload[i]`

3. **Update other status update calls**:
   - Replace all `updateFileStatus(fileName, status)` calls with direct object references
   - Ensure consistency across all status update locations

### Benefits:
- **Reliability:** Works correctly with duplicate filenames
- **Performance:** O(1) direct updates instead of O(n) array searches
- **Maintainability:** Cleaner code that works with object references
- **Correctness:** All files get their status updated regardless of name conflicts

### Files to Modify:
- `src/composables/useFileQueue.js` - Update `updateFileStatus` function
- `src/views/FileUpload.vue` - Update status update calls to pass file objects

This will fix the blue dot issue for files with duplicate names.

<template>
  <v-container fluid class="main-viewport">
    <!-- Main Upload Area -->
    <UploadDropzone
      v-if="uploadQueue.length === 0"
      ref="dropzoneRef"
      :is-drag-over="isDragOver"
      @drag-over="handleDragOver"
      @drag-leave="handleDragLeave"
      @drop="handleDrop"
      @trigger-file-select="triggerFileSelectWrapper"
      @trigger-folder-select="triggerFolderSelectWrapper"
      @file-select="handleFileSelect"
      @folder-select="handleFolderSelect"
    />

    <!-- Folder Options Dialog -->
    <FolderOptionsDialog
      :show="showFolderOptions"
      :subfolder-count="subfolderCount"
      :include-subfolders="includeSubfolders"
      :is-analyzing="isAnalyzing"
      :main-folder-analysis="mainFolderAnalysis"
      :all-files-analysis="allFilesAnalysis"
      :main-folder-progress="mainFolderProgress"
      :all-files-progress="allFilesProgress"
      :main-folder-complete="mainFolderComplete"
      :all-files-complete="allFilesComplete"
      :is-analyzing-main-folder="isAnalyzingMainFolder"
      :is-analyzing-all-files="isAnalyzingAllFiles"
      :analysis-timed-out="analysisTimedOut"
      :timeout-error="timeoutError"
      :current-progress-message="currentProgressMessage"
      :total-directory-entry-count="totalDirectoryEntryCount"
      @update:show="showFolderOptions = $event"
      @update:include-subfolders="includeSubfolders = $event"
      @confirm="confirmFolderOptions"
      @cancel="cancelFolderUpload"
    />

    <!-- Upload Queue/Preview -->
    <FileUploadQueue
      v-if="uploadQueue.length > 0 || isProcessingUIUpdate"
      class="flex-grow-1"
      :files="uploadQueue"
      :is-processing-ui-update="isProcessingUIUpdate"
      :ui-update-progress="uiUpdateProgress"
      :total-analyzed-files="totalAnalyzedFiles"
      :upload-status="uploadStatus"
      :show-time-progress="
        timeWarning.startTime.value !== null && (uploadQueue.length === 0 || isProcessingUIUpdate)
      "
      :time-progress="{
        elapsedTime: timeWarning.elapsedTime.value,
        progressPercentage: timeWarning.progressPercentage.value,
        isOverdue: timeWarning.isOverdue.value,
        overdueSeconds: timeWarning.overdueSeconds.value,
        timeRemaining: timeWarning.timeRemaining.value,
        formattedElapsedTime: timeWarning.formattedElapsedTime.value,
        formattedTimeRemaining: timeWarning.formattedTimeRemaining.value,
        estimatedDuration: timeWarning.estimatedDuration.value,
      }"
      :is-uploading="uploadStatus.isUploading"
      :is-paused="uploadStatus.isPaused"
      :is-starting-upload="isStartingUpload"
      @remove-file="removeFromQueue"
      @start-upload="handleStartUpload"
      @pause-upload="handlePauseUpload"
      @resume-upload="handleResumeUpload"
      @clear-queue="clearQueue"
    />

    <!-- Single File Upload Notification -->
    <v-snackbar
      v-model="showSingleFileNotification"
      :timeout="3000"
      :color="singleFileNotification.color"
      location="top"
    >
      {{ singleFileNotification.message }}
      <template #actions>
        <v-btn color="white" variant="text" @click="showSingleFileNotification = false">
          Close
        </v-btn>
      </template>
    </v-snackbar>

    <!-- Processing Progress Modal -->
    <ProcessingProgressModal
      v-model="processingProgress.isProcessing"
      :progress="processingProgress"
      :can-cancel="true"
      @cancel="handleCancelProcessing"
    />

    <!-- Cloud File Warning Modal -->
    <CloudFileWarningModal
      :is-visible="timeWarning.showCloudFileWarning.value"
      :formatted-elapsed-time="timeWarning.formattedElapsedTime.value"
      :estimated-duration="timeWarning.estimatedDuration.value"
      :overdue-seconds="timeWarning.overdueSeconds.value"
      @clear-all="handleClearAll"
      @continue-waiting="handleContinueWaiting"
      @close="handleCloseWarning"
    />

    <!-- Simple upload progress is now handled in the FileUploadQueue component directly -->
  </v-container>
</template>

<script setup>
import { ref, computed } from 'vue';
import FileUploadQueue from '../components/features/upload/FileUploadQueue.vue';
import UploadDropzone from '../components/features/upload/UploadDropzone.vue';
import FolderOptionsDialog from '../components/features/upload/FolderOptionsDialog.vue';
import ProcessingProgressModal from '../components/features/upload/ProcessingProgressModal.vue';
import CloudFileWarningModal from '../components/features/upload/CloudFileWarningModal.vue';
import { useFileQueue } from '../composables/useFileQueue.js';
import { useFileDragDrop } from '../composables/useFileDragDrop.js';
import { useQueueDeduplication } from '../composables/useQueueDeduplication.js';
import { useFolderOptions } from '../composables/useFolderOptions.js';
import { useTimeBasedWarning } from '../composables/useTimeBasedWarning.js';
import {
  calculateCalibratedProcessingTime,
  getStoredHardwarePerformanceFactor,
} from '../utils/hardwareCalibration.js';
import { storage } from '../services/firebase.js';
import { ref as storageRef, getDownloadURL, uploadBytesResumable } from 'firebase/storage';
import { useAuthStore } from '../stores/auth.js';
import { useLazyHashTooltip } from '../composables/useLazyHashTooltip.js';
import { useUploadLogger } from '../composables/useUploadLogger.js';
import { useFileMetadata } from '../composables/useFileMetadata.js';

// Component configuration
defineOptions({
  name: 'FileUploadView',
});

// Template refs
const dropzoneRef = ref(null);

// Auth store
const authStore = useAuthStore();

// Hash tooltip system for cache management
const { populateExistingHash } = useLazyHashTooltip();

// Upload logging system
const {
  startUploadSession,
  logUploadSession,
  getCurrentSessionId,
  getSessionDuration,
  logFileUploadEvent
} = useUploadLogger();

// File metadata system
const {
  createMetadataRecord,
  generateMetadataHash
} = useFileMetadata();

// Composables
const {
  uploadQueue,
  showSingleFileNotification,
  singleFileNotification,
  fileInput,
  folderInput,
  processingProgress,
  isProcessingUIUpdate,
  uiUpdateProgress,
  uploadStatus,
  triggerFileSelect,
  triggerFolderSelect,
  processSingleFile,
  addFilesToQueue,
  initializeQueueInstantly,
  updateUploadQueue,
  removeFromQueue,
  showNotification,
  setPhaseComplete,
  resetUploadStatus,
  updateUploadStatus,
  updateFileStatus,
  updateAllFilesToReady,
} = useFileQueue();

const {
  isDragOver,
  handleDragOver,
  handleDragLeave,
  handleDrop: baseHandleDrop,
} = useFileDragDrop();

const queueDeduplication = useQueueDeduplication();
const { processFiles } = queueDeduplication;

const {
  showFolderOptions,
  includeSubfolders,
  subfolderCount,
  isAnalyzing,
  mainFolderAnalysis,
  allFilesAnalysis,
  totalDirectoryEntryCount,
  // Timeout state
  analysisTimedOut,
  timeoutError,
  currentProgressMessage,
  skippedFolders,
  // Progress tracking
  mainFolderProgress,
  allFilesProgress,
  mainFolderComplete,
  allFilesComplete,
  isAnalyzingMainFolder,
  isAnalyzingAllFiles,
  processFolderEntry,
  processFolderFiles,
  confirmFolderOptions: baseConfirmFolderOptions,
  cancelFolderUpload,
} = useFolderOptions();

const timeWarning = useTimeBasedWarning();

// Upload state tracking  
const isStartingUpload = ref(false);
const isPaused = ref(false);
const pauseRequested = ref(false);
const currentUploadIndex = ref(0);
let uploadAbortController = null;

// Simple hash calculation function (same as worker)
const calculateFileHash = async (file) => {
  try {
    const buffer = await file.arrayBuffer();
    const hashBuffer = await crypto.subtle.digest('SHA-256', buffer);
    const hashArray = Array.from(new Uint8Array(hashBuffer));
    const hash = hashArray.map(b => b.toString(16).padStart(2, '0')).join('');
    
    // Return standard SHA-256 hash of file content
    return hash;
  } catch (error) {
    throw new Error(`Failed to generate hash for file ${file.name}: ${error.message}`);
  }
};

// Simple upload helper functions
const generateStoragePath = (fileHash, originalFileName) => {
  const extension = originalFileName.split('.').pop();
  return `teams/${authStore.currentTeam}/matters/general/files/${fileHash}.${extension}`;
};

const checkFileExists = async (fileHash, originalFileName) => {
  try {
    const storagePath = generateStoragePath(fileHash, originalFileName);
    const storageReference = storageRef(storage, storagePath);
    await getDownloadURL(storageReference);
    return true;
  } catch {
    return false;
  }
};

const uploadSingleFile = async (file, fileHash, originalFileName, abortSignal = null) => {
    const storagePath = generateStoragePath(fileHash, originalFileName);
    const storageReference = storageRef(storage, storagePath);
    
    const uploadTask = uploadBytesResumable(storageReference, file, {
      customMetadata: {
        teamId: authStore.currentTeam,
        userId: authStore.user.uid,
        originalName: originalFileName,
        hash: fileHash,
      },
    });

    return new Promise((resolve, reject) => {
      // Handle abort signal
      if (abortSignal) {
        abortSignal.addEventListener('abort', () => {
          uploadTask.cancel();
          reject(new Error('AbortError'));
        });
      }

      uploadTask.on(
        'state_changed',
        () => {
          // Check if aborted during progress
          if (abortSignal && abortSignal.aborted) {
            uploadTask.cancel();
            reject(new Error('AbortError'));
            return;
          }
          // Progress updates could be added here if needed
        },
        (error) => {
          reject(error);
        },
        async () => {
          // Upload completed successfully
          try {
            const downloadURL = await getDownloadURL(uploadTask.snapshot.ref);
            resolve({ success: true, downloadURL });
          } catch (error) {
            reject(error);
          }
        }
      );
    });
};

// Connect time monitoring to deduplication processing
queueDeduplication.setTimeMonitoringCallback({
  onProcessingStart: () => {
    // Time monitoring will be started when we have an estimate from folder analysis
  },
  onProcessingComplete: () => {
    timeWarning.resetMonitoring();
    queueDeduplication.terminateWorker();
  },
  onProcessingError: (error) => {
    timeWarning.resetMonitoring();
    queueDeduplication.terminateWorker();
    console.log('File processing error - time monitoring reset and workers terminated:', error);
  },
  onProcessingAborted: () => {
    queueDeduplication.terminateWorker();
    console.log('File processing aborted - workers terminated');
  },
});

// Legacy: Complex cleanup function replaced by simple page refresh

// Enhanced clearQueue that uses comprehensive cleanup
const clearQueue = () => {
  // Simple and reliable: just refresh the page
  console.log('ðŸ”„ Clear All: Refreshing page to reset all state');
  window.location.reload();
};


// Integrate processFiles with updateUploadQueue with safety filtering
const processFilesWithQueue = async (files) => {
  const processId = Math.random().toString(36).substr(2, 9);

  // Check if analysis has been aborted before processing
  if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
    console.log('Skipping file processing - analysis was aborted');
    return;
  }

  // Additional safety check - if queue is empty, processing was likely cancelled
  if (!files || files.length === 0) {
    console.log('Skipping file processing - no files to process');
    return;
  }

  // Start time monitoring if not already started and we have files to process
  if (files.length > 0 && !timeWarning.startTime.value) {
    const folderAnalysis = allFilesAnalysis.value || mainFolderAnalysis.value;
    let estimatedTime = 0;

    if (folderAnalysis && folderAnalysis.timeMs && folderAnalysis.timeMs > 0) {
      // Use existing folder analysis estimate (already hardware-calibrated)
      estimatedTime = folderAnalysis.timeMs;
    } else {
      // Generate hardware-calibrated estimate on-the-fly for files without folder analysis
      // No folder analysis available, generating hardware-calibrated estimate for file processing

      // Get stored hardware performance factor or use baseline
      let hardwarePerformanceFactor = getStoredHardwarePerformanceFactor();
      if (!hardwarePerformanceFactor || hardwarePerformanceFactor <= 0) {
        // Use baseline H-factor for new users (1.61 files/ms)
        hardwarePerformanceFactor = 1.61;
      }

      // Create file analysis data for calibrated estimation
      const sizeMap = new Map();
      files.forEach((file) => {
        const size = file.size || 0;
        sizeMap.set(size, (sizeMap.get(size) || 0) + 1);
      });
      const duplicateCandidates = files.filter((file) => sizeMap.get(file.size || 0) > 1);
      const duplicateCandidatesSizeMB =
        duplicateCandidates.reduce((sum, file) => sum + (file.size || 0), 0) / (1024 * 1024);

      const folderData = {
        totalFiles: files.length,
        duplicateCandidates: duplicateCandidates.length,
        duplicateCandidatesSizeMB: Math.round(duplicateCandidatesSizeMB * 10) / 10,
        avgDirectoryDepth: 2.5, // Default assumption for direct file processing
        totalDirectoryCount: 1,
      };

      // Generate hardware-calibrated estimate
      const calibratedPrediction = calculateCalibratedProcessingTime(
        folderData,
        hardwarePerformanceFactor,
      );
      estimatedTime = calibratedPrediction.totalTimeMs;

    }

    if (estimatedTime > 0) {
      timeWarning.startMonitoring(estimatedTime);
    } else {
      console.warn('Time monitoring not started: Unable to generate hardware-calibrated estimate');
    }
  }

  // Check if processing was aborted after time monitoring setup
  if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
    console.log('Aborting file processing - analysis was cancelled after time monitoring setup');
    return;
  }

  // Double-check safety filter: exclude any files from skipped folders
  if (skippedFolders.value && skippedFolders.value.length > 0) {
    const originalCount = files.length;
    const safeFiles = files.filter((file) => {
      const filePath = file.path || file.webkitRelativePath || file.name;
      const isInSkippedFolder = skippedFolders.value.some((skippedPath) => {
        const normalizedFilePath = filePath.replace(/\\/g, '/').toLowerCase();
        const normalizedSkippedPath = skippedPath.replace(/\\/g, '/').toLowerCase();
        return normalizedFilePath.startsWith(normalizedSkippedPath);
      });

      if (isInSkippedFolder) {
        console.log(`Upload safety filter: excluding ${filePath} from skipped folder`);
        return false;
      }
      return true;
    });

    if (safeFiles.length !== originalCount) {
      console.log(
        `Upload safety filter: excluded ${originalCount - safeFiles.length} files from ${skippedFolders.value.length} skipped folders`,
      );
    }

    // Final check before actually processing files
    if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
      console.log(`âŒ [${processId}] EXIT EARLY: aborted during file preparation`);
      return;
    }

    try {
      // Final abort check immediately before processFiles call
      if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
        console.log(`âŒ [${processId}] EXIT EARLY: aborted right before processFiles call`);
        return;
      }

      await processFiles(safeFiles, updateUploadQueue);

      // Check if processing was aborted after processFiles completed
      if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
        console.log(
          `âŒ [${processId}] EXIT ABORT: processing aborted after completion - skipping cleanup`,
        );
        return;
      }

      // Processing completed successfully - perform cleanup
      updateAllFilesToReady(); // Update all ready files to show blue dots
      timeWarning.resetMonitoring();
      queueDeduplication.clearTimeMonitoringCallback();
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error during file processing:', error);

      // Check if error was due to abort
      if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
        console.log(`âŒ [${processId}] EXIT ERROR ABORT: processing aborted during error handling`);
        return;
      }

      // Cleanup on error as well
      timeWarning.resetMonitoring();
      queueDeduplication.clearTimeMonitoringCallback();
      throw error; // Re-throw to maintain error handling
    }
  } else {
    // Final check before actually processing files (no folder filtering path)
    if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
      console.log('Aborting file processing - analysis was cancelled during preparation');
      return;
    }

    try {
      // Final abort check immediately before processFiles call
      if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
        console.log(`âŒ [${processId}] EXIT EARLY: aborted right before processFiles call`);
        return;
      }

      await processFiles(files, updateUploadQueue);

      // Check if processing was aborted after processFiles completed
      if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
        console.log(
          `âŒ [${processId}] EXIT ABORT: processing aborted after completion - skipping cleanup`,
        );
        return;
      }

      // Processing completed successfully - perform cleanup
      updateAllFilesToReady(); // Update all ready files to show blue dots
      timeWarning.resetMonitoring();
      queueDeduplication.clearTimeMonitoringCallback();
    } catch (error) {
      console.error('Error during file processing:', error);

      // Check if error was due to abort
      if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
        console.log(`âŒ [${processId}] EXIT ERROR ABORT: processing aborted during error handling`);
        return;
      }

      // Cleanup on error as well
      timeWarning.resetMonitoring();
      queueDeduplication.clearTimeMonitoringCallback();
      throw error; // Re-throw to maintain error handling
    }
  }

  // ðŸ” DEBUG: Log AsyncTracker state at successful exit
  if (window.__asyncTracker) {
    const exitStats = window.__asyncTracker.stats();
    console.log(`ðŸ“Š [${processId}] AsyncTracker at EXIT:`, exitStats);
  }
};

// Event handlers with composable integration
const handleFileSelect = async (event) => {
  updateRefs();
  const files = Array.from(event.target.files);
  if (files.length === 1) {
    await processSingleFile(files[0], processFilesWithQueue);
    showNotification('File ready for upload', 'success');
  } else {
    await addFilesToQueue(files, processFilesWithQueue);
  }
  // Reset input
  event.target.value = '';
};

const handleFolderSelect = (event) => {
  updateRefs();
  const files = Array.from(event.target.files);

  // File Explorer count will be compared automatically in processing
  // Pass callback to handle no-subfolder case automatically
  processFolderFiles(files, async (files) => {
    // Show Upload Queue instantly with first 100 files
    await initializeQueueInstantly(files);
    // Then process all files for deduplication
    addFilesToQueue(files, processFilesWithQueue);
  });
  // Reset input
  event.target.value = '';
};

const handleDrop = async (event) => {
  await baseHandleDrop(event, {
    processSingleFile: async (file) => {
      await processSingleFile(file, processFilesWithQueue);
      showNotification('File ready for upload', 'success');
    },
    addFilesToQueue: (files) => addFilesToQueue(files, processFilesWithQueue),
    processFolderEntry: (folder) =>
      processFolderEntry(folder, async (files) => {
        // Check if analysis has been aborted
        if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
          console.log('Aborting folder processing - analysis was cancelled');
          return;
        }

        // Show Upload Queue instantly with first 100 files
        await initializeQueueInstantly(files);

        // Check again before processing files for deduplication
        if (analysisTimedOut.value) {
          console.log('Aborting file queue processing - analysis was cancelled');
          return;
        }

        // Then process all files for deduplication
        addFilesToQueue(files, processFilesWithQueue);
      }),
  });
};

const confirmFolderOptions = () => {
  baseConfirmFolderOptions(async (files) => {
    // Show Upload Queue instantly with first 100 files
    await initializeQueueInstantly(files);
    // Then process all files for deduplication (time monitoring will start automatically)
    addFilesToQueue(files, processFilesWithQueue);
  });
};

// Update refs to use composable integration
const updateRefs = () => {
  if (dropzoneRef.value) {
    fileInput.value = dropzoneRef.value.fileInput;
    folderInput.value = dropzoneRef.value.folderInput;
  }
};

// Ensure refs are updated after component mount
const triggerFileSelectWrapper = () => {
  updateRefs();
  triggerFileSelect();
};

const triggerFolderSelectWrapper = () => {
  updateRefs();
  triggerFolderSelect();
};

// Handle cancel processing for progress modal
const handleCancelProcessing = () => {
  clearQueue();
};

// Cloud file warning modal handlers
const handleClearAll = () => {
  clearQueue();
};

const handleContinueWaiting = () => {
  // User chose to continue waiting
  timeWarning.snoozeWarning();
};

const handleCloseWarning = () => {
  // User closed warning without choosing action
  timeWarning.dismissWarning();
};

// Pause/Resume upload handlers
const handlePauseUpload = () => {
  console.log('Pause upload requested');
  pauseRequested.value = true;
  updateUploadStatus('requestPause');
};

const handleResumeUpload = () => {
  console.log('Resume upload requested');
  isPaused.value = false;
  updateUploadStatus('resume');
  
  // Continue upload from where we left off
  continueUpload();
};

// Resumable upload loop function
const continueUpload = async () => {
  try {
    console.log('Continuing upload process...');

    // Get files that are ready for upload (not duplicates)
    const filesToUpload = uploadQueue.value.filter(file => !file.isDuplicate);
    
    if (filesToUpload.length === 0) {
      showNotification('No files to upload (all are duplicates)', 'info');
      updateUploadStatus('complete');
      return;
    }

    // Start from current index or beginning
    const startIndex = uploadStatus.value.currentUploadIndex || 0;
    console.log(`Continuing from file ${startIndex + 1} of ${filesToUpload.length}`);

    // Process files from current index
    for (let i = startIndex; i < filesToUpload.length; i++) {
      // Check if pause was requested before processing next file
      if (pauseRequested.value) {
        console.log(`Pause requested at file ${i + 1}. Pausing...`);
        updateUploadStatus('setUploadIndex', i); // Save current position
        updateUploadStatus('pause');
        isPaused.value = true;
        pauseRequested.value = false;
        return;
      }

      const queueFile = filesToUpload[i];
      updateUploadStatus('setUploadIndex', i); // Update current position
      
      try {
        // Create abort controller for this upload
        uploadAbortController = new AbortController();

        // Calculate hash for the file (on-demand during upload)
        updateUploadStatus('currentFile', queueFile.name, 'calculating_hash');
        updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'uploading');
        console.log(`Calculating hash for: ${queueFile.name}`);
        let fileHash;
        
        // Check if file already has a hash (from deduplication process)
        if (queueFile.hash) {
          fileHash = queueFile.hash;
          console.log(`Using existing hash for: ${queueFile.name}`);
        } else {
          // Calculate hash now (for files with unique sizes or not previously processed)
          fileHash = await calculateFileHash(queueFile.file);
          // Store calculated hash in the queue file for reuse by tooltip system
          queueFile.hash = fileHash;
          // Also populate the tooltip cache immediately for instant tooltips
          populateExistingHash(queueFile.id || queueFile.name, fileHash);
          console.log(`Calculated new hash for: ${queueFile.name}`);
        }

        // Check if upload was aborted during hash calculation
        if (uploadAbortController.signal.aborted) {
          console.log(`Upload aborted during hash calculation for: ${queueFile.name}`);
          break;
        }

        // Check if file already exists in Firebase Storage
        updateUploadStatus('currentFile', queueFile.name, 'checking_existing');
        const fileExists = await checkFileExists(fileHash, queueFile.name);
        
        if (fileExists) {
          // File already uploaded previously
          console.log(`File already exists: ${queueFile.name}`);
          updateUploadStatus('previouslyUploaded');
          updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'previouslyUploaded');
          
          // Log individual upload event for skipped file
          try {
            await logFileUploadEvent({
              fileName: queueFile.name,
              fileHash: fileHash,
              fileSize: queueFile.size,
              lastModified: queueFile.lastModified,
              status: 'skipped',
              reason: 'already_exists'
            });
          } catch (logError) {
            console.error(`Failed to log upload event for existing file ${queueFile.name}:`, logError);
            // Don't fail the upload process for logging errors
          }
          
          // Create metadata record even for existing files (metadata may be different)
          try {
            await createMetadataRecord({
              originalName: queueFile.name,
              lastModified: queueFile.lastModified,
              fileHash: fileHash,
              sessionId: getCurrentSessionId()
            });
          } catch (metadataError) {
            console.error(`Failed to create metadata record for existing file ${queueFile.name}:`, metadataError);
            // Don't fail the upload process for metadata errors
          }
        } else {
          // Check if upload was aborted before uploading
          if (uploadAbortController.signal.aborted) {
            console.log(`Upload aborted before uploading: ${queueFile.name}`);
            break;
          }
          
          // File needs to be uploaded
          updateUploadStatus('currentFile', queueFile.name, 'uploading');
          console.log(`Uploading file: ${queueFile.name}`);
          
          // Log interrupted upload event before starting (will be overwritten on completion)
          try {
            await logFileUploadEvent({
              fileName: queueFile.name,
              fileHash: fileHash,
              fileSize: queueFile.size,
              lastModified: queueFile.lastModified,
              status: 'interrupted',
              reason: 'upload_started'
            });
          } catch (logError) {
            console.error(`Failed to log interrupted upload event for ${queueFile.name}:`, logError);
            // Don't fail the upload process for logging errors
          }
          
          const uploadStartTime = Date.now();
          await uploadSingleFile(queueFile.file, fileHash, queueFile.name, uploadAbortController.signal);
          const uploadDurationMs = Date.now() - uploadStartTime;
          updateUploadStatus('successful');
          updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'completed');
          console.log(`Successfully uploaded: ${queueFile.name}`);
          
          // Overwrite interrupted upload event with successful completion
          try {
            await logFileUploadEvent({
              fileName: queueFile.name,
              fileHash: fileHash,
              fileSize: queueFile.size,
              lastModified: queueFile.lastModified,
              status: 'uploaded',
              reason: 'upload_complete',
              uploadDurationMs: uploadDurationMs,
              allowOverwrite: true
            });
          } catch (logError) {
            console.error(`Failed to log upload completion event for ${queueFile.name}:`, logError);
            // Don't fail the upload process for logging errors
          }
          
          // Create metadata record for successfully uploaded file
          try {
            await createMetadataRecord({
              originalName: queueFile.name,
              lastModified: queueFile.lastModified,
              fileHash: fileHash,
              sessionId: getCurrentSessionId()
            });
          } catch (metadataError) {
            console.error(`Failed to create metadata record for ${queueFile.name}:`, metadataError);
            // Don't fail the upload process for metadata errors
          }
        }
      } catch (error) {
        if (error.name === 'AbortError') {
          console.log(`Upload aborted for: ${queueFile.name}`);
          break;
        }
        console.error(`Failed to upload ${queueFile.name}:`, error);
        updateUploadStatus('failed');
        updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'error');
        
        // Overwrite interrupted upload event with failure
        try {
          await logFileUploadEvent({
            fileName: queueFile.name,
            fileHash: fileHash,
            fileSize: queueFile.size,
            lastModified: queueFile.lastModified,
            status: 'failed',
            reason: 'upload_error',
            error: error.message || error.toString(),
            allowOverwrite: true
          });
        } catch (logError) {
          console.error(`Failed to log upload failure event for ${queueFile.name}:`, logError);
          // Don't fail the upload process for logging errors
        }
      } finally {
        uploadAbortController = null;
      }
    }

    // Check if we completed all files or were paused
    if (!isPaused.value) {
      updateUploadStatus('complete');
      console.log('Upload process completed:', {
        successful: uploadStatus.value.successful,
        failed: uploadStatus.value.failed,
        previouslyUploaded: uploadStatus.value.previouslyUploaded
      });

      // Log upload session completion
      try {
        const filesToUpload = uploadQueue.value.filter(file => !file.isDuplicate);
        const totalSizeMB = filesToUpload.reduce((sum, file) => sum + (file.size / (1024 * 1024)), 0);
        
        await logUploadSession({
          filesProcessed: filesToUpload.length,
          successful: uploadStatus.value.successful,
          failed: uploadStatus.value.failed,
          duplicatesSkipped: uploadQueue.value.length - filesToUpload.length,
          totalSizeMB: totalSizeMB
        });
      } catch (logError) {
        console.error('Failed to log upload session:', logError);
        // Don't fail the upload process for logging errors
      }

      // Show completion notification
      const totalProcessed = uploadStatus.value.successful + uploadStatus.value.previouslyUploaded;
      if (uploadStatus.value.failed === 0) {
        showNotification(`All ${totalProcessed} files processed successfully!`, 'success');
      } else {
        showNotification(`${totalProcessed} files processed, ${uploadStatus.value.failed} failed`, 'warning');
      }
      
      currentUploadIndex.value = 0;
      isStartingUpload.value = false;
    }

  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Upload process failed:', error);
    showNotification('Upload failed: ' + (error.message || 'Unknown error'), 'error');
    updateUploadStatus('complete');
    isPaused.value = false;
    currentUploadIndex.value = 0;
    isStartingUpload.value = false;
  }
};

// Simple upload control handler
const handleStartUpload = async () => {
  try {
    isStartingUpload.value = true;
    setPhaseComplete();
    
    // Reset upload status counters only if not resuming
    if (!isPaused.value) {
      resetUploadStatus();
      currentUploadIndex.value = 0;
      
      // Start upload session logging for new uploads
      const filesToUpload = uploadQueue.value.filter(file => !file.isDuplicate);
      await startUploadSession(filesToUpload.length);
    }
    
    updateUploadStatus('start');
    console.log('Starting upload process...');
    
    // Start the upload loop
    await continueUpload();

  } catch (error) {
    console.error('Upload process failed:', error);
    showNotification('Upload failed: ' + (error.message || 'Unknown error'), 'error');
    updateUploadStatus('complete');
    isPaused.value = false;
    currentUploadIndex.value = 0;
    isStartingUpload.value = false;
  }
};

// Legacy upload handlers removed - using simple upload system now

// Computed property for total analyzed files count
// Use directory entry count (File Explorer count) instead of processed files count
const totalAnalyzedFiles = computed(() => {
  // Return the directory entry count if available (shows what File Explorer sees)
  return totalDirectoryEntryCount.value > 0 ? totalDirectoryEntryCount.value : null;
});
</script>

:global(body) {

content.text:
## Fix Complete!

I've successfully implemented the fix for the file status update issue. Here's what was changed:

### **Files Modified:**

1. **`src/composables/useFileQueue.js`** - Updated the `updateFileStatus` function:
   - Now accepts either a file object (preferred) or filename (legacy)
   - Uses direct object reference instead of array search when possible
   - Maintains backward compatibility

2. **`src/views/FileUpload.vue`** - Updated all status update calls:
   - Changed from `updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, status)` to `updateFileStatus(queueFile, status)`
   - Now passes the actual file object instead of searching by name
   - Applied to all status updates: 'uploading', 'previouslyUploaded', 'completed', 'error'

### **How This Fixes the Issue:**

- **Before:** The system used `Array.find()` to search for files by name, which only found the FIRST file with a matching name
- **After:** The system uses direct object references, so each specific file object gets its status updated correctly
- **Result:** All files, including those with duplicate names, will now show the correct status dots

The fix ensures that the specific file with the duplicate name ("DRAFT TEMPLATE Pay Stubs and Batch Deductions.xlsx" in /2025/11. Tax Filings) will now correctly show an orange dot (ðŸŸ ) when it's found to be previously uploaded, just like the other files with the same name.

This approach is both more reliable (works with duplicate filenames) and more efficient (O(1) direct updates instead of O(n) array searches).

message.content: Caveat: The messages below were generated by the user while running local commands. DO NOT respond to these messages or otherwise consider them in your response unless the user explicitly asks you to.
<local-command-stderr>Error: Error during compaction: Error: Failed to generate conversation summary - response did not contain valid text content</local-command-stderr>

This session is being continued from a previous conversation that ran out of context. The conversation is summarized below: Analysis: Looking at this conversation chronologically: 1. **Initial Problem Report**: User reported that upload status dots in the file queue were not updating correctly. When processing files from the upload queue that were previously uploaded, some files showed orange dots (ðŸŸ ) while others kept their blue "ready" dots (ðŸ”µ), despite all being skipped due to already existing. 2. **Problem Pattern Analysis**: I analyzed the pattern and found that files 1-10 kept blue dots while files 11-22 got orange dots. This suggested a lazy loading issue where only the first 10 files were pre-loaded. 3. **Initial Investigation**: I examined multiple Vue components to understand the status dot system: - FileUploadQueue.vue - Main queue component with lazy loading - LazyFileItem.vue - Individual file item component displaying status dots - useFileQueue.js - Status update logic - FileUpload.vue - Upload process and status updates 4. **First Attempted Fix**: I initially tried to fix Vue reactivity by updating the component key to include file status, changing from `file.id || \`${groupIndex}-${fileIndex}\`` to include status. This partially worked but one file still showed a blue dot. 5. **Root Cause Discovery**: User feedback revealed that one specific file ("DRAFT TEMPLATE Pay Stubs and Batch Deductions.xlsx") was still showing a blue dot. Upon analysis, I discovered there were THREE files with the same name but different sizes/paths, and only two were updating correctly. 6. **Core Problem Identification**: The real issue was in the `updateFileStatus` function which used `Array.find(f => f.name === fileName)` to locate files by name. This only found the FIRST file with a matching name, leaving duplicate-named files unchanged. 7. **Final Solution**: I implemented a proper fix by: - Updating `updateFileStatus` to accept file objects directly instead of filenames - Modifying all upload process calls to pass file objects rather than names - Maintaining backward compatibility with string-based lookups Summary: 1. Primary Request and Intent: The user reported a bug where upload status dots in the file queue were not updating correctly. When files were found to be previously uploaded and skipped, some files correctly showed orange dots (ðŸŸ  for "previously uploaded") while others incorrectly kept their blue dots (ðŸ”µ for "ready"). The user wanted all previously uploaded files to consistently show orange dots. 2. Key Technical Concepts: - Vue.js reactivity system and component re-rendering - Lazy loading implementation with FileQueuePlaceholder and LazyFileItem components - Array-based file queue management with status tracking - File upload deduplication and hash-based existence checking - Component keying strategies for Vue reactivity - O(n) vs O(1) lookup performance considerations 3. Files and Code Sections: - **FileUploadQueue.vue** (lines 145-148): - Main upload queue component managing lazy loading - Initially updated Vue key from `file.id || \`${groupIndex}-${fileIndex}\`` to `\`${file.id || groupIndex + '-' + fileIndex}-${file.status || 'pending'}\`` to force re-renders on status changes - **LazyFileItem.vue** (lines 116-133): - Individual file item component displaying status dots - Contains logic for showing different colored dots based on file.status: ```vue ``` - **useFileQueue.js** (lines 101-115): - Originally contained flawed `updateFileStatus` function: ```javascript const updateFileStatus = (fileName, status) => { const file = queueCore.uploadQueue.value.find(f => f.name === fileName) if (file) { file.status = status } } ``` - Updated to accept file objects directly: ```javascript const updateFileStatus = (fileReference, status) => { let file; if (typeof fileReference === 'string') { file = queueCore.uploadQueue.value.find(f => f.name === fileReference) } else if (fileReference && typeof fileReference === 'object') { file = fileReference } if (file) { file.status = status } } ``` - **FileUpload.vue** (lines 699, 731, 790, 830): - Upload process that calls updateFileStatus - Changed from passing filenames to passing file objects: ```javascript // Before: updateFileStatus(queueFile.name, 'previouslyUploaded'); // After: updateFileStatus(queueFile, 'previouslyUploaded'); ``` 4. Errors and fixes: - **Initial Reactivity Issue**: First attempt using object spread (`{...file, status}`) broke all status updates. User reported "Now none of the blue dots are updating." I reverted this immediately. - **Partial Fix Success**: The Vue key update fixed most files but user reported one file still showed a blue dot. This led to discovering the core filename lookup issue. - **Filename Lookup Limitation**: The `Array.find()` approach only found the first file with a matching name, leaving files with duplicate names unchanged. User correctly identified this as "unreliable" and "slower" than array-based approaches. 5. Problem Solving: Successfully diagnosed and fixed a file status update system that was failing for files with duplicate names. The fix maintains backward compatibility while providing the preferred direct object reference approach. 6. 1â†’# File Upload System Documentation
     2â†’
     3â†’## Overview
     4â†’
     5â†’The Bookkeeper application features a sophisticated file upload system designed for law firms and professional services. It provides efficient file processing, deduplication, real-time progress tracking, and comprehensive audit logging with power-outage detection capabilities.
     6â†’
     7â†’## System Architecture
     8â†’
     9â†’### Core Components
    10â†’
    11â†’- **Upload Queue Management**: Real-time file processing with lazy loading UI
    12â†’- **Deduplication Engine**: SHA-256 hash-based duplicate detection 
    13â†’- **Progress Tracking**: Hardware-calibrated time estimation with 3-phase prediction
    14â†’- **Event Logging**: Individual file upload events with interruption detection
    15â†’- **Metadata Recording**: Constraint-based deduplication using metadata hashes
    16â†’- **Storage Management**: Team-scoped Firebase Storage with automatic deduplication
    17â†’
    18â†’## File Storage and Data Paths
    19â†’
    20â†’For complete documentation of all file storage paths and Firestore data structures, please refer to the single source of truth: **[docs/data-structures.md](./data-structures.md)**
    21â†’
    22â†’### Quick Reference
    23â†’- **File Storage**: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/files/{fileHash}.{extension}`
    24â†’- **Upload Session Logs**: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/logs/{documentId}`
    25â†’- **Individual Upload Events**: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/uploadEvents/{documentId}`
    26â†’- **File Metadata Records**: `/teams/{teamId}/matters/{matterId}/metadata/{metadataHash}`
    27â†’
    28â†’**Note**: All data structure schemas, field definitions, and storage strategies are maintained in `data-structures.md` to ensure consistency across the system.
    29â†’
    30â†’## Upload Process Flow
    31â†’
    32â†’### 1. File Selection & Analysis
    33â†’```
    34â†’User drops files/folder â†’ Folder analysis â†’ Time estimation â†’ Queue initialization
    35â†’```
    36â†’
    37â†’- **Instant Queue Display**: First 100 files shown immediately (< 60ms)
    38â†’- **Background Processing**: Remaining files processed in web workers
    39â†’- **Hardware Calibration**: System measures performance for accurate time predictions
    40â†’
    41â†’### 2. Deduplication Processing
    42â†’
    43â†’#### Size-Based Pre-filtering
    44â†’```javascript
    45â†’// Files with unique sizes skip hash calculation entirely
    46â†’uniqueSizeFiles = files.filter(file => sizeCount[file.size] === 1)
    47â†’duplicateCandidates = files.filter(file => sizeCount[file.size] > 1)
    48â†’```
    49â†’
    50â†’#### Hash-Based Verification
    51â†’```javascript
    52â†’// Only duplicate candidates undergo SHA-256 hashing
    53â†’for (const file of duplicateCandidates) {
    54â†’  file.hash = await calculateSHA256(file)
    55â†’  if (existingHashes.has(file.hash)) {
    56â†’    file.isDuplicate = true
    57â†’  }
    58â†’}
    59â†’```
    60â†’
    61â†’**Efficiency**: Typically 60-80% of files skip expensive hash calculation
    62â†’
    63â†’### 3. Upload Execution
    64â†’
    65â†’#### Interrupted Upload Detection System
    66â†’
    67â†’For complete documentation of upload event data structures and the interrupted upload detection system, please refer to: **[docs/data-structures.md](./data-structures.md#individual-upload-events)**
    68â†’
    69â†’**Flow Summary**:
    70â†’1. Start upload â†’ Create "interrupted" event (deterministic ID)
    71â†’2. Upload completes â†’ Overwrite with success/failure event  
    72â†’3. Power outage â†’ "interrupted" event remains as evidence
    73â†’
    74â†’#### Upload Loop Process
    75â†’```javascript
    76â†’for (const file of uploadableFiles) {
    77â†’  // 1. Log interrupted event
    78â†’  await logInterruptedEvent(file)
    79â†’  
    80â†’  // 2. Check if file exists in storage
    81â†’  if (await checkFileExists(file.hash)) {
    82â†’    // Skip file, log event, create metadata
    83â†’    await logSkippedEvent(file)
    84â†’    await createMetadataRecord(file)
    85â†’    continue
    86â†’  }
    87â†’  
    88â†’  // 3. Upload file
    89â†’  await uploadToFirebase(file)
    90â†’  
    91â†’  // 4. Overwrite interrupted event with success
    92â†’  await logSuccessEvent(file)
    93â†’  await createMetadataRecord(file)
    94â†’}
    95â†’```
    96â†’
    97â†’## User Interface System
    98â†’
    99â†’### Upload Queue Components
   100â†’
   101â†’#### Main Components
   102â†’- **UploadDropzone**: Drag-and-drop interface with file/folder selection
   103â†’- **FileUploadQueue**: Main queue display with lazy loading
   104â†’- **LazyFileItem**: Individual file items with status indicators
   105â†’- **ProcessingProgressModal**: Real-time progress during hash calculation
   106â†’- **QueueTimeProgress**: Hardware-calibrated time estimation display
   107â†’
   108â†’#### Progressive Loading Strategy
   109â†’```
   110â†’Small batches (â‰¤100 files): Load all immediately
   111â†’Large batches (>100 files): 
   112â†’  â†’ Show first 100 files instantly
   113â†’  â†’ Load remaining files in background
   114â†’  â†’ Update UI when complete
   115â†’```
   116â†’
   117â†’### Visual Status System (Color Dots)
   118â†’
   119â†’| Dot | Status | Meaning | Tooltip |
   120â†’|-----|--------|---------|---------|
   121â†’| ðŸ”µ | `ready` | Ready for upload | "Ready for upload" |
   122â†’| ðŸŸ¡ | `uploading` | Currently uploading | "Uploading..." |
   123â†’| ðŸŸ¢ | `completed` | Successfully uploaded | "Successfully uploaded" |
   124â†’| ðŸŸ  | `previouslyUploaded` | Already exists, skipped | "Already exists, skipped" |
   125â†’| ðŸ”´ | `error` | Upload failed | "Failed upload" |
   126â†’| ðŸŸ£ | `isDuplicate` | Queue duplicate, will skip | "Duplicate, will be skipped" |
   127â†’| âšª | `pending` | Processing/analyzing | "Pending" |
   128â†’
   129â†’### Real-Time Updates
   130â†’- **Status changes**: Dots update immediately when status changes
   131â†’- **Progress tracking**: Live progress bars during processing
   132â†’- **Upload notifications**: Success/failure notifications with detailed statistics
   133â†’
   134â†’## Metadata Hash Constraint-Based Deduplication
   135â†’
   136â†’For complete documentation of metadata hash generation, constraint-based deduplication logic, and use case examples, please refer to the single source of truth: **[docs/data-structures.md](./data-structures.md#file-metadata-records)**
   137â†’
   138â†’### Key Concepts
   139â†’- **File Content Hash**: SHA-256 of actual file content for storage deduplication
   140â†’- **Metadata Hash**: SHA-256 of `originalName|lastModified|fileHash` for metadata deduplication  
   141â†’- **Automatic Constraints**: Firestore document IDs prevent duplicate metadata records
   142â†’- **Multi-Level Deduplication**: Storage level (content) + metadata level (combinations)
   143â†’
   144â†’## Performance Optimization
   145â†’
   146â†’### Hardware-Calibrated Time Estimation
   147â†’
   148â†’#### Calibration Process
   149â†’```javascript
   150â†’// Measure files processed per millisecond during folder analysis
   151â†’const hFactor = filesProcessed / elapsedTimeMs
   152â†’
   153â†’// Store performance measurements for future predictions
   154â†’const predictions = {
   155â†’  phase1: (60 + (candidates * 6.5) + (sizeMB * 0.8)) * hardwareMultiplier,
   156â†’  phase2: (50 + (files * 0.52) + (avgDepth * 45)) * hardwareMultiplier
   157â†’}
   158â†’```
   159â†’
   160â†’#### 3-Phase Time Prediction
   161â†’1. **Phase 1: File Analysis** - Size-based duplicate detection (~60ms baseline)
   162â†’2. **Phase 2: Hash Processing** - SHA-256 calculation (hardware calibrated)  
   163â†’3. **Phase 3: UI Rendering** - DOM updates (complexity calibrated)
   164â†’
   165â†’### Web Worker Architecture
   166â†’```javascript
   167â†’// Background processing prevents UI blocking
   168â†’FileHashWorker â†’ SHA-256 calculation
   169â†’FileAnalysisWorker â†’ Path parsing and statistics
   170â†’UIUpdateWorker â†’ Batch DOM updates
   171â†’```
   172â†’
   173â†’### Lazy Loading System
   174â†’- **Placeholder Components**: Instant rendering with progressive enhancement
   175â†’- **Virtual Scrolling**: Handle thousands of files without performance loss
   176â†’- **On-Demand Loading**: Items load as they become visible
   177â†’
   178â†’## Error Handling & Recovery
   179â†’
   180â†’### Upload Interruption Detection
   181â†’- **Power Outage**: Interrupted events remain as permanent audit trail
   182â†’- **Network Failure**: Automatic retry logic with exponential backoff
   183â†’- **User Cancellation**: Clean cancellation with proper cleanup
   184â†’
   185â†’### Error Recovery Strategies
   186â†’```javascript
   187â†’// Upload retry logic
   188â†’let retryCount = 0
   189â†’const maxRetries = 3
   190â†’
   191â†’while (retryCount < maxRetries) {
   192â†’  try {
   193â†’    await uploadFile(file)
   194â†’    break // Success
   195â†’  } catch (error) {
   196â†’    retryCount++
   197â†’    await delay(Math.pow(2, retryCount) * 1000) // Exponential backoff
   198â†’  }
   199â†’}
   200â†’```
   201â†’
   202â†’### Data Consistency
   203â†’- **Transactional Operations**: Metadata and event logging use Firestore transactions
   204â†’- **Rollback Capabilities**: Failed operations trigger automatic cleanup

   206â†’
   207â†’## Security Considerations

   211â†’- **Matter-Level Organization**: Files organized by legal matters
   212â†’- **Firebase Security Rules**: Server-side access control enforcement
   213â†’
   214â†’### File Validation
   215â†’- **Size Limits**: Configurable per-file and per-batch limits
   216â†’- **Type Restrictions**: MIME type validation and extension checking  
   217â†’- **Hash Verification**: Content integrity verification using SHA-256
   218â†’
   219â†’### Data Privacy
   220â†’- **Encryption in Transit**: HTTPS for all file transfers
   221â†’- **Encryption at Rest**: Firebase Storage server-side encryption
   222â†’- **Audit Logging**: Complete trail of access and modification events
   223â†’
   224â†’## API Reference
   225â†’
   226â†’For complete data structure schemas and field definitions used by these APIs, please refer to: **[docs/data-structures.md](./data-structures.md)**
   227â†’

   239â†’// See data-structures.md for complete field definitions

   241â†’  fileName: 'document.pdf',
   242â†’  fileHash: 'abc123...',
   243â†’  status: 'uploaded',
   244â†’  reason: 'upload_complete',
   245â†’  allowOverwrite: true
   246â†’})
   247â†’```
   248â†’
   249â†’#### Metadata Management
   250â†’```javascript

   252â†’
   253â†’// See data-structures.md for complete field definitions  
   254â†’await createMetadataRecord({
   255â†’  originalName: 'document.pdf',
   256â†’  lastModified: timestamp,
   257â†’  fileHash: 'abc123...',
   258â†’  sessionId: 'session_123'
   259â†’})

   261â†’
   262â†’### Configuration Options

   266â†’const uploadConfig = {

   268â†’  maxBatchSize: 500 * 1024 * 1024,   // 500MB per batch  
   269â†’  allowedTypes: ['.pdf', '.docx', '.jpg'],

   290â†’- **Deduplication Efficiency**: Percentage of duplicates detected

   319â†’
